channel.title: math.QA updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.QA updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Braided Logarithmic Vertex Algebras
item.description: arXiv:2406.08458v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study a family of algebras defined using a locally-finite endomorphism called a braiding map. When the braiding map is semi-simple, the algebra is a generalized vertex algebra, while when the braiding map is locally-nilpotent we have a logarithmic vertex algebra. We describe a method that associates to these algebras non-local Poisson vertex algebras, and we use this relation to build a new example of a generalized vertex algebra motivated by the non-linear Schr\"odinger non-local Poisson vertex algebra
item.dc:creator: Bojko Bakalov, Juan J. Villarreal

item.title: Degenerate twisted traces on quantized Kleinian singularities of type A
item.description: arXiv:2406.07708v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We study the space of non-degenerate traces on quantized Kleinian singularities of type A by studying their complement, the degenerate traces. In particular, we find the dimension of the space of twisted traces as a function of the corresponding automorphism and the quantization parameters, encoded in a polynomial $P$.
item.dc:creator: Zev Friedman, Ben Webster

item.title: Quantum $SL(2,\mathbb{R})$ and its irreducible representations
item.description: arXiv:2107.04258v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We define for real $q$ a unital $*$-algebra $U_q(\mathfrak{sl}(2,\mathbb{R}))$ quantizing the universal enveloping $*$-algebra of $\mathfrak{sl}(2,\mathbb{R})$. The $*$-algebra $U_q(\mathfrak{sl}(2,\mathbb{R}))$ is realized as a $*$-subalgebra of the Drinfeld double of $U_q(\mathfrak{su}(2))$ and its dual Hopf $*$-algebra $\mathcal{O}_q(SU(2))$, generated by the equatorial Podle\'s sphere coideal $*$-subalgebra $\mathcal{O}_q(K\backslash SU(2))$ of $\mathcal{O}_q(SU(2))$ and its associated orthogonal coideal $*$-subalgebra $U_q(\mathfrak{k}) \subseteq U_q(\mathfrak{su}(2))$. We then classify all the irreducible $*$-representations of $U_q(\mathfrak{sl}(2,\mathbb{R}))$.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Journal of Operator Theory, Volume 91, Issue 2, Spring 2024 pp. 443-470
item.dc:creator: Kenny De Commer, Joel Right Dzokou Talla

item.title: Partial $*$-algebraic quantum groups and Drinfeld doubles of partial compact quantum groups
item.description: arXiv:2204.02900v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We introduce a notion of partial algebraic quantum group. This is an important special case of a weak multiplier Hopf algebra with integrals, as introduced in the work of Van Daele and Wang. At the same time, it generalizes the notion of partial compact quantum group as introduced by De Commer and Timmermann. As an application, we show that the Drinfeld double of a partial compact quantum group can be defined as a partial $*$-algebraic quantum group.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Journal of Algebra Journal of Algebra, Volume 634, 15 November 2023, Pages 345-403
item.dc:creator: Kenny De Commer, Johan Konings

item.title: On classification of Hopf superalgebras of low dimension
item.description: arXiv:2306.04122v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We examine the inverse procedure of the Radford-Majid bosonization for Hopf superalgebras and give a handy method for enumerating Hopf superalgebras whose bosonization is isomorphic to a given Hopf algebra. As an application, we classify Hopf superalgebras of dimension up to 5 and give examples of higher dimensions.
item.dc:creator: Taiki Shibata, Ryota Wakao

item.title: Drinfeld rational fractions for affine Kac-Moody quantum symmetric pairs
item.description: arXiv:2311.13705v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We formulate a precise connection between the new Drinfeld presentation of a quantum affine algebra $U_q\widehat{\mathfrak{g}}$ and the new Drinfeld presentation of affine coideal subalgebras of split type recently discovered by Lu and Wang. In particular, we establish a ``factorization formula'', expressing the commuting ``Drinfeld-Cartan''-type operators $\Theta_{i,k}$ in a coideal subalgebra in terms of the corresponding Drinfeld generators of $U_q\widehat{\mathfrak{g}}$, modulo the ``Drinfeld positive half" of $U_q\widehat{\mathfrak{g}}$. We study the spectra of these operators on finite dimensional representations, and describe them in terms of rational functions with an extra symmetry. These results can be seen as the starting point of a $q$-character theory for affine Kac--Moody quantum symmetric pairs. Additionally, we prove a compatibility result linking Lusztig's and the Lu-Wang-Zhang braid group actions.
item.dc:creator: Tomasz Przezdziecki

item.title: On the geometry and bounded cohomology of racks and quandles
item.description: arXiv:2302.02760v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We introduce and investigate a natural family of metrics on connected components of a rack. The metrics are closely related to certain bi-invariant metrics on the group of inner automorphisms of the rack. We also introduce a bounded cohomology of racks and quandles, relate them to the above metrics and prove a certain vanishing result for racks and quandles with amenable group of inner automorphisms.
item.dc:creator: Jarek K\k{e}dra
